etymologies: late 19th century: from catalysis, on the pattern of analyse

definitions: cause or accelerate (a reaction) by acting as a catalyst

examples.text: the enzyme catalyzes the oxidation of acetaldehyde

shortDefinitions: cause or accelerate reaction by acting as catalyst

definitions: cause (an action or process) to begin

examples.text: the tragic event helped to catalyze the already growing popular anger

shortDefinitions: cause action or process to begin
